file_content.text: Keep your voices down--I'm almost certain this room is bugged. The Republic could be monitoring our every word.
I'm Lieutenant Trace. I've been tracking Republic signals buzzing in and out of this base for weeks.
I finally had to put a lockdown on all outgoing transmissions. My men can't even speak to their own mothers without my say-so.
You're dressed casually for an officer.
Where's your uniform?
My uniform was a logical hiding place for any bugs--so I burned it. Been in these same civies for six days now.
You see this? It's a Republic transmitter. One of my men--dead now--tried to plant one under my desk a few weeks ago.
I traced the bug's signal to a nearby Republic listening post--a communications hub of some sort.
Turns out that listening post houses one of the Republic's primary satellite arrays. It's the keystone of their entire communications network on Taris.
It's located on the outskirts of a rakghoul-infested ravine. Our patrols won't go anywhere near it. Should've known better.
We have an opportunity here to end Republic snooping--leave their spies cut off and their forces running blind.
Unfortunately, I don't know which of my men I can trust, so I need you to run this one. Can you destroy that listening post?
The Republic's forces are helpless without that hub.
Ha! All the Republic channels suddenly turned to static.
By the time they get everything back online, we'll have already mopped up their scattered forces. Nicely done.
The Republic had you bugged. Your men need to be dealt with.
You still may have spies here.
Don't worry. With no one to transmit to, they won't be able to do any harm. Sooner or later they'll get desperate and slip up.
I know what I'm doing.
I'll vouch for that.
It's all over.
What a relief it'll be to have a private conversation again. I do all my best thinking aloud.
I'll do a thorough check for any remaining bugs and have the other bases do the same. We'll purge those spies yet.
Let's hope surprise is still on our side with this one.
Speak softly, my lord. The Republic could be listening in on us this very moment.
Keep your voice down--I'm almost certain this room is bugged. The Republic may be monitoring our every word.
Don't you think you're overreacting?
You're being paranoid.
Good you dealt with the problem before it got out of hand.
Smart move.
Still, there's no telling how much information has already been leaked.
Sounds like an ideal target.
Let's destroy it.
I knew you'd see the silver lining.
How did they keep such an important outpost hidden for so long?
You only just discovered it?
Why come to me?
I want you to take that listening post out of commission.
The Empire must regain its superiority--and its dignity.
This needs to be done.
Indeed. Having them pry into our every secret is demoralizing--and potentially embarrassing.
It will be amusing to watch the Republic fumble about blindly.
It'd be my pleasure.
I couldn't agree more.
As long as the credits are there, you'll find my loyalty unwavering.
If there's money in it.
I'm more than happy to reward those who deserve it.
Protecting the Empire's secrets is what I do.
This is my specialty.
Then this will be right up your alley.
If there's no one else to do it, I suppose I'll have to.
If I must.
Knock out the satellite array, and you'll render the entire listening post inoperable.
Remember, though, that place is a military facility--and anyone who can survive in that wilderness will be a formidable opponent.
I'm busy. [Refuse quest]
I can't keep up this constant vigilance forever.
The Republic has eyes and ears all throughout this base.
